content: > ** stay in the loop join my newsletter 1 ** > *you will receive a welcome email with a 25% discount off all of my patterns > i ll keep you up to date with all of > my news and every time i release a > pattern you ll get a discount coupon > every time newsletters are usually > sent about once a month so i promise > not to overrun your inbox * ---------------------------------------- you can find the sock weight version here 2 just love the colours in variegated yarns but don t know what to knit with them always be brave is the ideal solution team up one colourful yarn with you favourite contrasting neutral and create this stunning shawl the shawl features a very simple construction using an easily memorized 12 row repeat it starts with a focus on the neutral yarn and a simple slip_stitch technique creates highlighted row of textured coloured bubbles the effect is then reversed by making the variegated yarn the star this shawl is knit in sport weight yarn making it that little bit cosier for those colder days as well as being faster to knit but you can use sock or dk weights and just adjust the number of repeats you make just remember your yarn requirements will differ from the pattern **recommended yarn ** malabrigo arroyo 100% merino wool 335 yd/306 m per 100g skein mc natural 1 skein cc acro iris 1 skein **size ** width #76 inches/193 cm depth at deepest point ~20 inches/51 cm **difficulty/stitches required ** adventurous beginner- intermediate knit purl k2tog kfbf slipped stitches i-cord bind off 1 https //mailchi mp/1949629f04dd/rp6udcvfj2 2 https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/always-be-brave-shawl---the-sock-edit
